sections.title: The Board Setup Disaster
sections.content:
**40% of movies get this wrong!**

The most basic rule in chess: **'White square on the right!'** Each player should have a light-colored square in their bottom-right corner.

**Hall of Shame**:

**Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me (1999)**
- Board rotated 90°
- Character is Russian (chess-obsessed nation!)
- Irony Level: 10/10

**The Shawshank Redemption (1994)**
- Board oriented incorrectly
- Andy Dufresne is portrayed as meticulous genius
- Would NEVER set up board wrong
- Breaks character believability

**The Silence of the Lambs (1991)**
- Entomologists playing chess
- Board backwards
- Scientists miss basic setup

**The Seventh Seal (1957)**
- Even Bergman's iconic Death chess scene has wrong board!
- Classic film, basic error

**Why It Happens**: Prop departments don't check. Fix would take 2 seconds.

sections.title: The 'Evil Genius Overlooks Mate in 1' Trope
sections.content:
**The Pattern**:
1. Movie establishes character as chess mastermind
2. Shows chess game to demonstrate intelligence
3. Character overlooks obvious checkmate in 1 move
4. Chess players everywhere scream at screen
5. Movie continues, oblivious

**Why Chess Players Hate This**:
- Breaks immersion instantly
- Shows lazy research (5 minutes would fix it)
- Trying to show intelligence, displays stupidity
- It's like showing 'genius mathematician' who can't add 2+2

**The Meme**:
```
Movie Villain: 'I'm 10 moves ahead'
*Board shows mate in 1 for opponent*
Chess Players: 'You're 1 move behind, genius'
```

**How to Fix It**:
- Hire chess consultant ($500-2000)
- Use actual famous game positions
- Or don't show board closeup!
- **Cost**: 0.001% of film budget

sections.title: Films That Got It RIGHT ✅
sections.content:
**The Queen's Gambit (2020)**
- Consultant: Garry Kasparov + Bruce Pandolfini
- Every position verified
- Actors trained in chess
- Used actual famous games
- Result: Chess players LOVED it
- Impact: 62 million viewers, chess boom

**Pawn Sacrifice (2014)**
- 1972 Fischer vs. Spassky match
- Real game positions used
- Tobey Maguire learned chess for role
- Consultants ensured accuracy

**Searching for Bobby Fischer (1993)**
- Josh Waitzkin (real person) consulted
- Tournament scenes realistic
- Positions make sense
- Chess community approved

**2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)**
- Used real game (Roesch-Schlage, 1910)
- HAL vs. Frank Poole
- 95% accurate (minor debate on one move)
- Kubrick did his research!

**The Lesson**: Hire ONE chess player. It's not hard!

sections.title: Most Common Movie Mistakes
sections.content:
**Error #1: Board Orientation (40% of movies)**
- White square should be on right
- Most frequent error
- Instantly noticeable to players

**Error #2: Illegal Positions**
- Two bishops on same color (without promotion)
- Pawns on first or eighth rank
- Three queens per side (unexplained)
- Random piece placement

**Error #3: Impossible Moves**
- Knight moving like bishop
- Pieces jumping illegally
- Castling through check
- Capturing your own pieces

**Error #4: 'Checkmate!' When It's Not**
- Position shown is just check, not mate
- Or not even check at all
- Character announces dramatically anyway

**Error #5: Instant Genius**
- Character never played before
- Suddenly beats grandmaster
- No explanation or training shown
- Unrealistic: Chess takes years to master

sections.title: How Chess Players React
sections.content:
**Internet Comments (Real Quotes)**:

'Just saw [Movie X]. Chess board backwards. Literally unwatchable.'

'Movie budget: $100 million. Chess consultant: $1000. Board set up wrong: Priceless.'

'Every chess movie: ✅ Cool music ✅ Dramatic lighting ✅ Intense stares ❌ Legal positions ❌ Sensible moves ❌ Correct board orientation'

'Hollywood: Hire ONE chess player. Just one. We'll work for pizza.'

'*Pauses movie to check board* It's not even check. Day ruined.'

**Why It Matters**:
For chess players, seeing board setup wrong is like seeing actor hold gun upside down or drive car from passenger seat. It's so obviously wrong that it destroys suspension of disbelief.

**The Frustration**: It's SO easy to fix! Google 'chess board setup' takes 30 seconds. But directors often don't care because most audience won't notice.
